item.title: Developing a Resizable-Indexed Array as a PHP Extension with Joe Watkins
item.description: Following on from our first screencast, which touched upon how to set up a PHP extension development environment and the creation of a simple array_sum-like function. We now further this topic by implementing a resizable-indexed array class which supplies very similar functionality to that of the SplFixedArray class.

item.title: PHP Extension Development for Beginners with Joe Watkins
item.description: In the very first screencast episode of Three Devs and a Maybe, I was fortunate to chat with PHP core developer Joe Watkins, discussing PHP 5 and 7 extension development for beginners.

item.title: Introduction to Creating a Basic PHP Extension
item.description: I recently decided to test my novice C skills in the field of building a PHP extension. However, despite some very good resources (here and here), there still seems to be a lack of beginner-friendly material on the subject. In this post I will document a simple development environment that has worked well on a fresh CentOS 6.5 installation. Once this has been set up, we will then move on to creating a simple ‘Hello World’ extension, highlighting some of the extension platform’s capabilities.
